Pre-Game Insights: Eugenio Suarez is coming off a one-hit showing in his most recent game (1-for-4) and will take the field for the Arizona Diamondbacks versus Frankie Montas and the Milwaukee Brewers on Sunday.
Suarez has racked up a team-high 97 runs batted in and has hit 28 home runs.
Suarez ranks 25th in home runs and 15th in RBI among all hitters in MLB play.
Suarez takes a five-game hitting streak into this game, hitting .273 with two RBI in his last five games.
Suarez is 1-for-7 in his career versus Frankie Montas and 0-for-3 when matching up against Montas this season.
In 60.0% of his 150 games this season, Suarez has notched a base hit (90 times) and has put up 36 multi-hit games in 2024 (24.0%).
Suarez has gone yard in 25 of 150 games in 2024 (16.7%), which is 4.6% of his trips to the dish.
Suarez has touched home plate at least one time in 59 out of 150 games this season (39.3%), with more than one run scored in 18 of them (12.0%).
Suarez has picked up an RBI in 38.0% of his 150 games this year, with two or more RBI in 14.7% of them (22). He has also driven in three or more runs in 10 contests.
Suarez has gone down on strikes one or more times 107 times this season in 150 tries (71.3%), including punching out on multiple occasions in 30.7% of games (46 times).
Frankie Montas gets the start for the Brewers in his 29th of the season. He holds a record of 7-11 with a 4.50 ERA and 138 Ks in 144 2/3 innings pitched.
Montas's last outing came on Tuesday versus the Philadelphia Phillies, when the right-hander threw 5 2/3 innings, allowing three earned runs while giving up six hits.
Montas has posted nine quality starts this season.
